intro: Heterotropa variegata, commonly known as the variegated heterotropa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves with a striking variegation pattern of green and white. The plant produces small, purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
